content: The problem with the pirates is difficult to solve. Ground strikes risk a lot of collateral damage, and there are hostages at risk. We could bring back convoys, and use destroyers to escort merchant vessels. This is expensive and ties up Navy assets that could be needed for real emergencies. Besides that, destroyers will not capture any actual pirates, because the pirates will not come out to play when destroyers are in view. Moreover, there are tons of fishing boats, making it difficult to pick out boats on piratical missions. Therefore, bring back the Q-boats: ships enticingly disguied as fat, tempting, weak targets for pirates, but are in fact heavily armed with hidden weapons. Choose whatever is their favorite kind of vessel. Flag with any countries flag--they're going to think twice about attacking US flagged ships in the future--probably! So send out a tramp steamer loaded down with gleaming Hummers. When the pirates show their cards and intentions, the SEAL team pops up and sends them to Davy Jones Locker. As the probability of certain death climbs, this will act as a deterrent. It would be cheap: the cost of a SEAL team or two versus the payrolls associated with several destroyers. It would turn the principles of asymmetric warfare against the rascals. It would be beautiful. I think it would work. Q ships!
